channel.title: [317] Special Attack [317]
channel.description:
Hi can anybody tell me how to add special attacks to a 317 server
I don't have the special attack button what do i do is there any tut's i tryed following [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,343373.0/topicseen.html] this one[/url] but i got confused
item id's
5698 - dds 4151 - whip 1215 - dd 1249 - d spear 1305 - d longsword 1377 - DBA 1434 - d mace 3204 - d hally 4587 - d scim 7158 - d 2 h
Thankyou if anyone could provide me with these spec's it would be much appreciated

uhm go to you’r spec Folder and just add case (id number) and it will have a special bar For adding specs themselfs you gota go in your’r Client.java It should have the specials already coded

item.title: [317] Special Attack [317]
item.dc:creator: @mad_moparscapian mad_moparscapian
item.description:
@mad_moparscapian wrote:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4151 && specialAmount > 49){ AttackingOn2.specGFX(341); specialAmount -= 50; hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit) + misc.random(StrPrayer) + misc.random(voidmelee); lastSpecial = System.currentTimeMillis(); setAnimation(1658); actionInterval = getbattleTimer(); lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); specOn = false; }

Where would i put this? i searched for

& specialAmount >
in my client.java and i found nothing.

Please can you include some better instructions

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Special Attack [317]
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

you need a gfx list…

gfx list cause when you attack you put

specGFX(GFXID);

then you gotta make like this hit like say 30 to 60

so

hitDiff = 30 + misc.random(60);

you also need the item id at the top…

heres one example of complete gfx for whip

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4151 && specialAmount > 49){
AttackingOn2.specGFX(341);
specialAmount -= 50;
hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit) + misc.random(StrPrayer) + misc.random(voidmelee);
lastSpecial = System.currentTimeMillis();
setAnimation(1658);
actionInterval = getbattleTimer();
lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
specOn = false;
}

Read full topic
